title: Anonymous Interview
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process, simple and straightforward questions. 1st and 2nd round interviews with the team which was very standard and engaging. Just wanted to know if I was the right fit for the company and want to work in their heart-centered culture.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to make a difficult decision, what did you do?

title: Teacher Interview
Interview Descriptions: Applying wasn't that hard. Pretty straight forward.  Submitted resume, they reached out fairly quickly and formal one on one interview with director and assistant director. They asked pretty standard questions, then brought you to the room and let you interact with the children to see how you were with them.
Interview Questions: What is the number one concern within the classroom?

title: Mfti Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penny Lane (Lancaster, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview. Asked a series of questions and gave a vignette. Not too bad. They want people to know that the paperwork is a lot and that they have high goals in reaching your productivity. People have gotten fired because of not reaching it. So it is important to know what you are getting into before accepting. They also pay well. So thats a bonus.
Interview Questions: Name the goal and intervention you would use for this vignette.

title: Clinical (Medical) Record Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Penny Lane
Interview Descriptions: Did not have interview with Penny Lane. I went through the agency (Apple One).  The Agency sent me to Penny Lane. I did all my testing at the agency.

title: TBS Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penny Lane
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews. Was offered a different position than I applied for. Supervisor at my house was very awkward and appear to be uncomfortable in the interview. 3 stage interview process

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penny Lane
Interview Descriptions: They ask a lot of clinical questions and there is even a few vignettes you need to complete and discuss with the supervisors.
Interview Questions: They ask typical questions like strengths and weaknesses and career goals.
